translation: dokuczać, nękać [to confuse, annoy, or cause problems or difficulties for someone or something]
sentence: Ever since I started playing tennis, I've been bedevilled by back pains.

translation: zostawić w spadku, zapisywać (w testamencie) [formal; to arrange for money or property to be given to somebody after your death]
sentence: Picasso bequeathed most of his paintings and sculptures to Spain and France.

translation: środek odstraszający [something that stops people doing something because they are afraid of what will happen if they do]
sentence: They've installed a security camera as a deterrent to thieves.
The players were disconsolate after losing what should have been an easy game.
The teacher has a genial manner.

translation: niezapomniany, trwały [impossible to forget or remove]
sentence: His performance of Hamlet left an indelible impression on all who saw it. The blood had left an indelible mark on her shirt.

translation: bluszcz [an evergreen plant that often grows up trees or buildings]
mruczeć, szemrać [to say something in a soft, quiet voice that is difficult to hear or understand]
łajza, niezdara [old-fashioned; a stupid, rude, or awkward person, especially a man]
sentence: Watch that cup, you clumsy oaf!

translation: podobieństwo [the fact that two people or things look like each other or are similar in some other way]
sentence: There was a clear family resemblance between all the brothers.
